channel.title: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?

item.title: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?
item.dc:creator: @dd1 dd
item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

[code] outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(4); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@cya@Trade with");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
if(wildyoff == 0)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
if(wildyoff == 1)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(3); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@cya@Attack");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
IsInWilderness = true;
}

if(playerRights > 0 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“sphinx”))
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(5); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@red@Kick");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}[/code]

item.title: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

Thanks, I also get 100 errors with this:

[code] outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(4); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@cya@Trade with");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
if(wildyoff == 0)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
if(wildyoff == 1)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
}
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(3); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@cya@Attack");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
IsInWilderness = true;

if(playerRights > 0 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“sphinx”))
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(5); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@red@Kick");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}

//end of ban list[/code]

item.source: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?

item.title: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?
item.dc:creator: @dd1 dd
item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

In your packet 153, which is

case 153: //Fun Fight if(wildyoff == 0) { AttackingOn = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian(); server.ffHandler.funfight(playerId, AttackingOn); if(wildyoff == 1) { sendMessage("Fun fight has currently been disabled."); } break; }

Put a else between

case 153: //Fun Fight if(wildyoff == 0) { AttackingOn = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian(); server.ffHandler.funfight(playerId, AttackingOn);

and

if(wildyoff == 1) { sendMessage("Fun fight has currently been disabled."); } break; }

Should be something like…

case 153: //Fun Fight if(wildyoff == 0) { AttackingOn = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian(); server.ffHandler.funfight(playerId, AttackingOn); } else if(wildyoff == 1) { sendMessage("Fun fight has currently been disabled."); } break; }

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?

item.title: Why is this funfight enable and disable not working?
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

Well, what happens, is someone right clicks someone and it says “funfight” and when they click that it teleports them and the player to a fun fight area. But I tried to make a command, that when we type ::funfightoff it turns it off, and when we type, ::funfighton, it turns it on.

Here is the command:

[code] if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“funfightoff”) && (playerRights >= 3)) {

	    if(wildyoff == 0) {
	wildyoff = 1; //remember if it is 1 the funfight should be off.
  sendMessage("funfight is now Disabled");
	PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has Disabled funfight";
    }
}
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("funfighton") && (playerRights >= 3)) {

	    if(wildyoff == 1) {
	wildyoff = 0; // 0 means fun fight is on.
  sendMessage("funfight is now Enabled");

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has Enabled funfight";
}
}[/code]

This is what I added for my interface thing:

if(wildyoff == 0) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } if(wildyoff == 1) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); }

This is what I added for packet 153:

case 153: //Fun Fight if(wildyoff == 0) { AttackingOn = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian(); server.ffHandler.funfight(playerId, AttackingOn); if(wildyoff == 1) { sendMessage("Fun fight has currently been disabled."); } break; }

When I type ::funfightoff, it works but it keeps wanting to trade, also it does not send the message that I want it to send. If I show you this in more detail:

[code] outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(4); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@cya@Trade with");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();

if(wildyoff == 0)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}
if(wildyoff == 1)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(2); // command slot
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("@gre@Fun Fight");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}[/code]

I was thinking if I need to add a bracket, because I guess it is going to trade when fun fight if off, because it is open

Thanks

Musicmad441
